hull_mods.name: Accelerated Shields
hull_mods.desc: Increases the turn rate of the ship's shields by %s and the rate at which the shields are raised by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases shield turn rate and extension speed.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the shield's turn rate and raise rate by an additional %s.

hull_mods.name: Adaptive Phase Coils
hull_mods.desc:
Phase coils are less able to maintain a connection with normal space as the ship's hard flux levels rise, resulting in a greatly reduced top speed as the coils struggle to gain traction.

This modification allows the coils to handle higher levels of hard flux, increasing the threshold at which speed bottoms out by %s. For standard-design coils with no other modifications, this takes the threshold from %s to %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces impact of hard flux level on top speed while phased.

hull_mods.name: Advanced Optics
hull_mods.desc: Extends the range of beam weapons by %s, but reduces their turn rate by %s. Cumulative with Integrated Targeting Unit.
hull_mods.short: Increases beam weapon range.

hull_mods.name: Advanced Turret Gyros
hull_mods.desc: Increases the turn rate of all turrets by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases turret turn rate.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases damage to missiles and fighters by %s. Increases damage to smaller ships by %s per size class of difference.

hull_mods.name: Armored Weapon Mounts
hull_mods.desc: Increases the durability of all weapons by %s and reduces recoil by %s, but decreases weapon turn rate by %s. Also increases the ship's armor by %s.
hull_mods.short: Makes weapons harder to disable, reduces recoil.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the rate of fire of all non-missile weapons by %s.

hull_mods.name: Assault Package
hull_mods.desc:
Increases the ship's hull integrity by %s, armor by %s, and flux capacity by %s.

Will try to engage enemies and otherwise act as a combat ship in battle.
hull_mods.short: Increases hull integrity, armor, and flux capacity.

hull_mods.name: Automated Repair Unit
hull_mods.desc: Reduces the time required to repair disabled weapons and engines (in combat) by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases weapon repair rate in combat.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Reduces repair time to %s, and reduces overload duration by %s.

hull_mods.name: Auxiliary Thrusters
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ship's maneuverability by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases maneuverability.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the 0-flux speed boost by %s, and %s the 0-flux turn rate bonus.

hull_mods.name: Ballistic Rangefinder
hull_mods.desc: <tooltip created in the script due to lots of highlighting>
hull_mods.short: Increases base range of small and medium weapons in ballisic slots.

hull_mods.name: Blast Doors
hull_mods.desc:
Installs additional hermetic and heavily reinforced doors at critical junctures throughout the ship. Increases hull integrity by %s.

Ship takes %s fewer crew casualties from hull damage sustained in combat.
hull_mods.short: Increases hull integrity, reduces crew casualties.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the crew casualty reduction to %s.

hull_mods.name: Converted Hangar
hull_mods.desc: <Tooltip created in script>
hull_mods.short: Improvised fighter bay for non-carriers.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the rate at which the fighter replacement rate recovers by %s for cruisers, and by %s for capital ships. No added effect for destroyers.

hull_mods.name: Converted Fighter Bay
hull_mods.desc: Converts the ship's fighter bays housing built-in wings into improvised cargo holds, giving it an additional %s cargo capacity and reducing its crew requirements by %s per fighter bay. The crew reduction is limited to a maximum of %s.
hull_mods.short: Converts built-in fighter bays into improvised cargo holds.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Monthly maintenance cost reduced by %s per fighter bay.

hull_mods.name: Dedicated Targeting Core
hull_mods.desc:
Increases the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s/%s for cruisers/capital ships.

Can not be installed on a frigate or a destroyer, and can not work in conjunction with Integrated Targeting Unit.

Most combat ships install either an Integrated Targeting Unit or a Dedicated Targeting Core, with the exception of more specialized variants.
hull_mods.short: Increases weapon range, more so for larger ships.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the range bonus to %s for cruisers and %s for capital ships.

hull_mods.name: Defensive Targeting Array
hull_mods.desc:
Standard fighter communication links are re-purposed to provide short-range targeting data.

Increases fighter damage to missiles and other fighters by %s, but makes the fighters unable to leave the vicinity of their ship.
hull_mods.short: Increases fighter PD damage, reduces fighter roam range to zero.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Extends range of ballistic and energy weapons of the ship's fighters by %s units.

hull_mods.name: ECCM Package
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces the chance for missiles launched by the ship to be affected by electronic counter-measures and flares by %s.

A CPU core adjunct in each missile increases missile top speed by %s and missile maneuverability by %s, as well as significantly improving the guidance algorithm.

Also reduces the weapon range reduction due to enemy ECM by %s.
hull_mods.short: Improves missile speed and guidance, reduces effect of enemy Electronic Warfare.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Fully negates the weapon range reduction, and makes the ship's missiles always ignore flares.

hull_mods.name: ECM Package
hull_mods.desc: When deployed in combat, grants %s/%s/%s/%s ECM rating, depending on this ship's hull size.
hull_mods.short: Increases ship's ECM rating.

hull_mods.name: Escort Package
hull_mods.desc:
When this ship is within approximately %s su of a larger friendly vessel, increases this ship's maneuverability by %s, and top speed by %s. Also increases ballistic and energy weapon range by %s.

These bonuses are %s for destroyers when the nearby friendly is a capital ship.
hull_mods.short: Increases maneuverability, top speed, and weapon range when near larger friendly ship.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Destroyers: reduces the amount of damage taken by shields by %s. No added effect for cruisers.

hull_mods.name: Expanded Deck Crew
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces the rate at which the fighter replacement rate decreases due to fighter losses by %s, and increases the rate at which it recovers by %s.

Increases the crew required by %s per fighter bay.
hull_mods.short: Improves fighter replacement rate, increases crew requirements.

hull_mods.name: Expanded Magazines
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ammo capacity or the number of charges for ballistic and energy weapons by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases ammo/charges for ballistic and energy weapons.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the ammo/charge regeneration rate for ballistic and energy weapons by %s.

hull_mods.name: Expanded Missile Racks
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases missile weapon ammo.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Reduces the rate of fire of missile weapons by %s.

hull_mods.name: Extended Shields
hull_mods.desc: Increases the shield's coverage by %s degrees.
hull_mods.short: Increases maximum shield arc.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the shield's coverage by an additional %s degrees.

hull_mods.name: Flux Coil Adjunct
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ship's flux capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Not as efficient as flux capacitors - most useful when added to a design that already carries the maximum possible number of capacitors.
hull_mods.short: Increases flux capacity.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases flux capacity by a further %s/%s/%s/%s, making the coil as efficient as adding capacitors.

hull_mods.name: Flux Distributor
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ship's flux dissipation by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Not as efficient as flux vents - most useful when added to a design that already carries the maximum possible number of vents.
hull_mods.short: Increases flux dissipation.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases flux dissipation by a further %s/%s/%s/%s, making the distributor as efficient as adding vents.

hull_mods.name: Shield Shunt
hull_mods.desc: Removes the ship's shields. The external emitter nodes are replaced with reinforced plating, increasing the ship's armor by %s.
hull_mods.short: Removes shields, increases armor.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the ship's armor by an additional %s.

hull_mods.name: Makeshift Shield Generator
hull_mods.desc:
Installs a makeshift, inefficient shield generator on the ship. The shield emitter is locked in a forward-facing position and has a %s degree arc.

The shield generator draws much of its power from engines and reduces the ship's top speed by %s.
hull_mods.short: Installs basic shields on shieldless ship. Reduces top speed.

hull_mods.name: Missile Autoloader
hull_mods.desc: <tooltip created in the script due to sections/other complexity>
hull_mods.short: Reloads missile weapons in small missile mounts
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the post-reload cooldown to %s seconds.

hull_mods.name: Hardened Shields
hull_mods.desc: Reduces the amount of damage taken by shields by %s. Also reduces the chance that shields will be pierced by EMP arcs from weapons like the Ion Beam.
hull_mods.short: Reduces damage taken by shields.

hull_mods.name: Hardened Subsystems
hull_mods.desc:
Increases peak operating time for ships that suffer degraded performance from extended deployment by %s.

Also reduces the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases peak time, CR degrades more slowly.

hull_mods.name: Heavy Armor
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ship's armor by %s/%s/%s/%s points, depending on hull size.
hull_mods.short: Increases armor.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Reduces the ship's maneuverability by %s.

hull_mods.name: High Scatter Amplifier
hull_mods.desc: <tooltip created in the script due to sections>
hull_mods.short: Reduces beam range; beams deal more damage and apply hard flux to shields.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases beam weapon damage by an additional %s.

hull_mods.name: Integrated Point Defense AI
hull_mods.desc: Gives all point-defense weapons the ability to identify - and ignore - decoy flares. In addition, all point-defense weapons get the best possible target leading, regardless of combat readiness, and all damage to missiles is increased by %s.
hull_mods.short: PD ignores decoy flares, improved target leading, more damage to missiles.
hull_mods.sModDesc: All small non-missile, non-strike weapons are classified as "point-defense", automatically target missiles, and are affected by point-defense stat modifiers.

hull_mods.name: #Point Defense Integration
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces the ordnance point cost of small point-defense weapons by %s. The cost reduction only affects weapons that have PD capability as a feature of the weapon itself, and not when it's gained through other means such as from a hullmod.

In addition, all point-defense weapons deal %s more damage to all targets.
hull_mods.short: Reduces ordnance point cost of small PD weapons, increases all PD damage.

hull_mods.name: Integrated Targeting Unit
hull_mods.desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Can not work in conjunction with Dedicated Targeting Core.

Most combat ships install either an Integrated Targeting Unit or a Dedicated Targeting Core, with the exception of more specialized variants.
hull_mods.short: Increases weapon range, more so for larger ships.

hull_mods.name: Nav Relay
hull_mods.desc:
When deployed in combat, increases nav rating of your fleet by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on this ship's hull size.

The total nav rating of your fleet increases the top speed of your deployed ships.
hull_mods.short: Increases top speed of deployed ships.

hull_mods.name: Neural Interface
hull_mods.desc:
Links the flagship with another ship, allowing both ships to %s at the same time. As with "transfer command", some skill effects - such as those increasing ammo capacity, or combat readiness - do not apply to the other ship.

Also enables rapid switching between the linked ships without using a shuttle pod. The transfer is instant if the combined deployment points of the ships are %s or less. The destination ship must not be under the command of an officer or an AI core.
hull_mods.short: Allows rapid switching between ships, resets system cooldown and adds a charge.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Transfers from the ship are always instant, regardless of the deployment point total.

hull_mods.name: Neural Integrator
hull_mods.desc:
An augmented version of Neural Interface that works with automated ships by enabling direct control of all of the ship's systems via the link and allowing both ships to %s at the same time. As with "transfer command", some skill effects - such as those increasing ammo capacity, or combat readiness - do not apply to the other ship.

Also enables rapid switching between the linked ships without using a shuttle pod. The transfer is instant if the combined deployment points of the ships are %s or less. The destination ship must not be under the command of an officer or an AI core.

The complexity of the modifications increases the ship's deployment points and supply cost to recover from deployment by %s.
hull_mods.short: Specialized Neural Interface for automated ships.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Transfers from the ship are always instant, regardless of the deployment point total.

hull_mods.name: Shield Conversion - Front
hull_mods.desc: Locks the ship's omni-directional shield emitter to a front-facing position and extends its arc by %s. As with all frontal emitters, the shield will also deploy twice as quickly.
hull_mods.short: Converts omni shield to front, extends arc.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Reduces the amount of damage taken by shields by %s.

hull_mods.name: Shield Conversion - Omni
hull_mods.desc: Converts frontal shields to omni-directional. Reduces the shield's arc by %s.
hull_mods.short: Converts front shield to omni, reduces arc.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Negates the shield arc penalty.

hull_mods.name: Operations Center
hull_mods.desc: Increases the command point recovery rate by %s when installed on the flagship.
hull_mods.short: Increases command point recovery rate when on flagship.

hull_mods.name: Phase Anchor
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces the phase cloak's activation cost to %s. Increases the soft flux dissipation and weapon recharge rate by %s while phased.

When suffering critical damage that would otherwise destroy or disable the ship, able to initiate an emergency dive deep into p-space. The ship counts as retreated and will emerge into normal space when combat is over, suffering an additional penalty to combat readiness equal to %s its deployment cost. The ship must have enough combat readiness to cover this cost to initiate the dive.

Due to the immense distortions in p-space caused by such a maneuver, only one ship per battle - regardless of which side it's on - is able to perform it.
hull_mods.short: Increases flux dissipation and weapon recharge while phased, emergency dive maneuver.

hull_mods.name: Recovery Shuttles
hull_mods.desc: Reduces the casualties suffered by fighter pilots by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces fighter pilot casualties.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the fighter pilot casualty reduction to %s.

hull_mods.name: Reinforced Bulkheads
hull_mods.desc: Increases the ship's hull integrity by %s. If disabled, the ship will not break apart and is almost always recoverable after the battle.
hull_mods.short: Increases hull integrity; ship almost always recoverable if lost.

hull_mods.name: Resistant Flux Conduits
hull_mods.desc: Decreases the amount of EMP damage taken from weapons such as Ion Cannons by %s. Also increases the ship's flux dissipation rate while venting by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces EMP damage taken, improves venting speed.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the flux dissipation rate while venting by a further %s.

hull_mods.name: Safety Overrides
hull_mods.tags: special, engines, offensive, merc, no_build_in, standard
hull_mods.desc:
Disabling safety protocols increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s (depending on ship size, with a corresponding increase in acceleration) and allows the zero-flux engine boost to take effect regardless of flux level. The flux dissipation rate, including that of additional vents, is increased by a factor of %s.

Reduces the peak performance time by a factor of %s, prevents the use of active venting, and drastically reduces weapon ranges past %s units.

Can not be installed on civilian or capital ships.
hull_mods.short: Drastic improvement in performance, much lower peak time.

hull_mods.name: Stabilized Shields
hull_mods.desc: Reduces the amount of soft flux raised shields generate per second by %s. Does not affect the hard flux generated as a result of shields taking damage.
hull_mods.short: Reduces flux upkeep for shields.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Converts %s of the hard flux damage taken by shields to soft flux.

hull_mods.name: Unstable Injector
hull_mods.desc:
Increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s/%s/%s/%s su/second, depending on hull size.

Interferes with weapons targeting and other vulnerable systems, reducing non-missile weapon range by %s and increasing the fighter replacement time by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases speed, reduces weapon range.

hull_mods.name: Additional Berthing
hull_mods.desc:
Increases maximum crew capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases crew capacity.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Doubles the crew capacity increase and, for civilian hulls, negates the maintenance cost increase.

hull_mods.name: Augmented Drive Field
hull_mods.desc: Increases maximum burn level by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases maximum burn level.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases maximum burn level by a further %s.

hull_mods.name: Auxiliary Fuel Tanks
hull_mods.desc:
Increases maximum fuel capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases fuel capacity.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Doubles the fuel capacity increase and, for civilian hulls, negates the maintenance cost increase.

hull_mods.name: Efficiency Overhaul
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces supply use for maintenance, fuel use, and minimum crew required by %s.

Increases the combat readiness recovery and repair rates by %s. The per-day supply consumption for CR recovery is increased to account for the increased recovery rate, but the total supply cost remains the same.
hull_mods.short: Reduces ongoing costs and enables more deployments.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Reduces maintenance cost, fuel use, and minimum crew requirement by a further %s.

hull_mods.name: Expanded Cargo Holds
hull_mods.desc:
Increases maximum cargo capacity by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size, or by %s, whichever is higher.

For civilian-grade hulls, also increases maintenance supply use by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases cargo capacity.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Doubles the cargo capacity increase and, for civilian hulls, negates the maintenance cost increase.

hull_mods.name: High Resolution Sensors
hull_mods.desc: <Tooltip created in script>
hull_mods.short: Increases fleet's sensor range.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the ship's in-combat vision range by %s/%s/%s/%s, based on hull size.

hull_mods.name: Insulated Engine Assembly
hull_mods.desc:
Increases the durability of the ship's engines by %s, and the ship's hull integrity by %s.

The ship's sensor profile is also reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Makes engines harder to disable, lowers sensor profile.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases engine durability by a further %s, and Increases the sensor profile reduction to %s.

hull_mods.name: Militarized Subsystems
hull_mods.desc:
Removes the penalties from a civilian-grade hull, and increases maximum burn level by %s.

Increases minimum crew required by %s.
hull_mods.short: Removes sensor penalties, increases maximum burn level, increases crew required.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Negates the increased crew requirements.

hull_mods.name: Solar Shielding
hull_mods.desc:
Originally developed by Diktat engineers after spending cycles dealing with the unique conditions of the inner Askonia system. Decreases the effect operating in a solar corona has on combat readiness by %s; also has the same effect against storms in deep hyperspace.

In combat, reduces energy damage taken by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces effect of being in corona and energy damage taken.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the protection from solar coronae and similar hazards to %s.

hull_mods.name: Surveying Equipment
hull_mods.desc: Reduces the heavy machinery and supplies required to perform surveys by %s/%s/%s/%s depending on hull size, down to a minimum of %s for each.
hull_mods.short: Reduces resource requirements for surveying.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the survey cost reduction by %s.

hull_mods.name: Terminator Core
hull_mods.desc: Gives all point-defense weapons the ability to identify - and ignore - decoy flares. In addition, all weapons get the best possible target leading, regardless of combat readiness, all damage to missiles and fighters is increased by %s, and beam weapon range is increased by %s units.

hull_mods.name: Shared Flux Sink
hull_mods.desc: Handles %s of the flux dissipation of all attached modules. If modules are lost during battle, the extra flux dissipation is redistributed among the remaining modules. Up to %s of this extra dissipation applies to hard flux.
hull_mods.short: Flux/hard flux dissipation bonus as modules are lost.

hull_mods.name: Stealth Minefield
hull_mods.desc: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.
hull_mods.short: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.

hull_mods.name: Stealth Minefield - Low Tech
hull_mods.desc: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.
hull_mods.short: Mines attack enemy ships during battle.

hull_mods.name: B-Deck
hull_mods.desc:
Once per combat, when the fighter replacement rate reaches %s, the fighter launch bays are switched over to operate from a "B-Deck".

Standby fighters are launched to rapidly bring the wings back up to full strength, and the fighter replacement rate is set to %s.
hull_mods.short: Launches fresh wing once per combat and replenishes the replacement rate.

hull_mods.name: Fighter Chassis Storage
hull_mods.desc: Fighter replacement rate does not go down when fighters are lost.
hull_mods.short: Fighter replacement rate does not go down.

hull_mods.name: Shield Always On
hull_mods.short: Forces shield to stay on. Hidden, doesn't need description or icon.

hull_mods.name: Missile Autoforge
hull_mods.desc: An autoforge inside the ship periodically fully reloads the magazines of all missile weapons.
hull_mods.short: Periodically reloads all missile weapons.

hull_mods.name: Shielded Cargo Holds
hull_mods.desc: Commonly found on ships that can't always rely on shields to protect their cargo from cosmic radiation. Only a few tweaks are needed to have the shielding confound long-range cargo scans, reducing the probability of contraband being detected.
hull_mods.short: Improves chance to avoid detection of contraband.

hull_mods.name: Salvage Gantry
hull_mods.desc: Increases the resources gained from salvaging abandoned stations, derelicts, floating hulks, and other such by %s/%s/%s/%s, depending on hull size. Only affects the recovery of common resources such as fuel and supplies, and not rare items like blueprints. In addition, %s of the bonus applies to post-battle salvage.
hull_mods.short: Increases resources gained from salvage.

hull_mods.name: Phase Field
hull_mods.desc: The ship is able to run a low-grade phase field for extended periods of time, reducing its effective sensor profile by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces fleetwide sensor profile.

hull_mods.name: Flux Shunt
hull_mods.desc: Allows the ship to dissipate hard flux at %s of the normal rate while shields are on.
hull_mods.short: Allows dissipation of hard flux while shields are up.

hull_mods.name: Civilian-grade Hull
hull_mods.desc: Increases sensor profile by %s. Reduces sensor strength by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases sensor profile, reduces sensor strength.

hull_mods.name: High Maintenance
hull_mods.desc: Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases maintenance cost.

hull_mods.name: Energy Bolt Coherer
hull_mods.desc: <tooltip created in the script>
hull_mods.short: Increases base range of non-beam energy weapons.

hull_mods.name: Design Compromises
hull_mods.desc:
The ship's performance suffers from competing design priorities, with multiple bleeding-edge projects integrated too late in the design cycle.

The ship's flux dissipation and capacity, even the nominal base values, are reduced by %s.

The range of ballistic weapons is reduced by %s, the rate of fire of missile weapons is reduced by %s, and the flux generation of energy weapons is increased by %s.

On the plus side, extra nanoforge capacity can be brought online more easily, allowing the installation of a %s despite the ship already having a fighter bay, increasing the number of operational fighter bays to %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces missile and ballistic weapon range, and flux dissipation / capacity.

hull_mods.name: Monofilament Tow Cable
hull_mods.desc:
Improves the maximum burn level of the slowest ship in the fleet by 1. Multiple tugs can not be used to speed up the same ship by more than 1.

Can not be used in combat.
hull_mods.short: Increases burn level of another ship.

hull_mods.name: Drive Field Stabilizer
hull_mods.desc:
Stabilizes the fleet's drive bubble, increasing the maximum burn of the fleet by %s. The effect of multiple stabilizers is cumulative.

Increases the ship's sensor profile by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces fleetwide fuel use.

hull_mods.name: Ground Support Package
hull_mods.desc: Close support weapons and counter-measures for ground defenses. Increases the effective strength of planetary raids by %s, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.
hull_mods.short: Improves effectiveness of raids.

hull_mods.name: Advanced Ground Support
hull_mods.desc: Close support weapons and counter-measures for ground defenses. Increases the effective strength of planetary raids by %s, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.
hull_mods.short: Improves effectiveness of raids.

hull_mods.name: Delicate Machinery
hull_mods.desc:
The ship systems require excessive maintenance and do not stand up well under the rigours of prolonged engagements.

Increases the rate of in-combat CR decay after peak performance time runs out by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases CR decay rate after peak time runs out.

hull_mods.name: Heavy Ballistics Integration
hull_mods.desc: Reduces the ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces ordnance point cost of large ballistic weapons.

hull_mods.name: Vast Hangar
hull_mods.desc:
The ship has a huge hangar and a commensurate small fleet of support craft.

The number of fighter bays added by Converted Hangar is increased by %s, and its performance matches that of a dedicated fighter bay - all of the penalties and modifiers, including those to the ship's deployment cost, are negated.
hull_mods.short: Increases the effect of Converted Hangar and removes its penalties.

hull_mods.name: Rugged Construction
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces most negative effects of d-mods by %s. If disabled or destroyed in combat, the ship has a %s chance to avoid new d-mods, and is almost always recoverable after the battle.

In addition, the supply cost to recover from deployment - and to effect repairs if the ship is disabled - is reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces impact of d-mods; ship almost always recoverable if lost.

hull_mods.name: Automated Ship
hull_mods.desc: This ship is fully automated, and does not require - and can not take on - any human crew.
hull_mods.short: Does not require and can not support crew.

hull_mods.name: Advanced Targeting Core
hull_mods.desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Precludes the installation of a Dedicated Targeting Core or an Integrated Targeting Unit.
hull_mods.short: Greatly extends non-missile weapon range.

hull_mods.name: Targeting Supercomputer
hull_mods.desc:
Extends the range of ballistic and energy weapons by %s. The range of point-defense weapons is only extended by %s.

Also increases target-leading accuracy and greatly increases in-combat sensor range.
hull_mods.short: Greatly extends non-missile weapon range.

hull_mods.name: Experimental Phase Coils
hull_mods.desc: Reduces phase cloak cooldown by %s.
hull_mods.short: Greatly reduces phase cloak cooldown.

hull_mods.name: High Volition Attractor
hull_mods.desc: An experimental modification allowing high-frequency motes to be warped in by the rift core on board the ship.
hull_mods.short: Launches more powerful high-frequency motes.

hull_mods.name: Ablative Armor
hull_mods.desc:
An ancient design intended to stop micro-meteorites through sheer volume of material in place, before the advent of "spaced" armor.

Reduces the effective armor strength for the damage reduction calculation to %s of its actual value. However, ships of this design tend to carry extremely heavy armor.
hull_mods.short: Reduces damage reduction by armor.

hull_mods.name: Distributed Fire Control
hull_mods.desc: Much of the damage that takes weapons offline is to external control runs and power conduits. This ship's weapons are engineered to operate more independently, reducing their exposure to damage by %s and reducing the EMP damage taken by the ship overall by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases weapon durability and reduces EMP damage taken.

hull_mods.name: Converted Cargo Bay
hull_mods.desc: This ship's cargo hold has been converted to house a pair of fighter bays. The improvised manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.
hull_mods.short: Pair of improvised fighter bays.

hull_mods.name: Special Modifications
hull_mods.desc:
During an inspection of an early prototype, the Supreme Executor was heard to comment unfavorably on exposed conduits running along the passageways, and the danger these must pose to the brave and loyal crew under combat conditions. 

The new chief designer, a loyal officer appointed by the Supreme Executor himself, instructed the forge-programmers to make accommodations for the installation of special blast-proof insulated paneling produced by Sindria itself.

If the passages are a bit narrower, conduits prone to overheating, and flush-set panels somewhat unwieldy to access, the official readiness reports include no criticism of the changes. Everyone agrees in both public and - as the Internal Security Ministry can attest - in private, that the stark grandeur of the Lion's Guard fleet is breathtaking.

Crew casualties in combat are increased by %s. The base flux dissipation rate is reduced by %s, and the repair rate for disabled weapons and engines is reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces the ship's performance.

hull_mods.name: Vast Bulk
hull_mods.desc: The main body of this structure is vast and is, for practical purposes, capable of absorbing any amount of damage from conventional weapons without being destroyed.

hull_mods.name: Axial Rotation
hull_mods.desc: This structure constantly rotates around its axis.

hull_mods.name: Anchor Rotation
hull_mods.desc: This structure rotates around its anchor attachment point. For station modules only.

hull_mods.name: Reduced Explosion
hull_mods.desc: Reduced explosion radius and damage.

hull_mods.name: Always Detaches
hull_mods.desc: Always detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

hull_mods.name: Never Detaches
hull_mods.desc: Never detaches from parent structure when destroyed.

hull_mods.name: No Weapon Flux
hull_mods.desc: Weapon fire costs no flux. Used on fighters for fine-grained control of effective shield hitpoints.

hull_mods.name: Do Not Fire Through
hull_mods.desc: Weapons on other modules of a station will avoid firing through this module, even though the shots would go over it and not hit.

hull_mods.name: Shard Spawner
hull_mods.desc: Spawns shard ships when ship is disabled/destroyed.

hull_mods.name: Do Not Back Off
hull_mods.desc: Sets DO_NOT_BACK_OFF AIFlag

hull_mods.name: Threat Hull
hull_mods.desc: Hidden hullmod for managing the special properties of Threat ships. Description created in script.

hull_mods.name: Fragment Swarm
hull_mods.desc:
A swarm of Threat fragments roils around the ship, providing a regenerating supply of fragments for fragment-based weapons.

The base number of fragments is %s/%s/%s/%s, and replacement fragments are launched %s/%s/%s/%s times a second, depending on hull size.

This hullmod is required for fragment weapons to function, if the hullmod is not present or there are not enough fragments in the swarm, fragment weapons will be disabled.
hull_mods.short: A swarm of Threat fragments roils around the ship.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Reduces maximum combat readiness by %s and increases the maintenance cost by %s.

hull_mods.name: Secondary Fabricator
hull_mods.desc: Increases the rate at which replacement fragments are launched by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases the fragment replacement rate.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the fragment replacement rate by a further %s.

hull_mods.name: Fragment Coordinator
hull_mods.desc: Increases the maximum number of fragments in the ship's fragment swarm by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases the size of the fragment swarm around the ship.
hull_mods.sModDesc: Increases the size of the fragment swarm by a further %s.

hull_mods.name: Dweller Hullmod
hull_mods.desc: Adds Shrouded Dweller visuals and any custom mechanics. Not visible to the player.

hull_mods.name: Shrouded Mantle
hull_mods.desc:
The ship will attempt to recoil (hopefully) away from danger when taking substantial hull damage.

Crew casualties in combat are increased by %s.
hull_mods.short: The ship recoils away from damage.
hull_mods.sModDesc: The ship benefits from %s of the healing provided by Hungering Rift.

hull_mods.name: Shrouded Thunderhead
hull_mods.desc: <created by script>
hull_mods.short: The ship fires Rift Lightning bolts at recent targets of its weapons.

hull_mods.name: Shrouded Lens
hull_mods.desc: <created by script>
hull_mods.short: The Lens automatically focuses on nearby targets, dealing damage in an area.

hull_mods.name: Fourteenth Battlegroup
hull_mods.desc: This ship is a survivor of the original 14th Domain Battlegroup which founded the Hegemony. It is a prime specimen of the Domain Navy's "decisive battle" doctrine, particularly exhibited by a series of radical structural modifications (performed with pre-Collapse industrial methods) which allow the mounting of heavier armor plating by a flat increase of %s standard units, with only a %s reduction in speed and maneuverability. Exceptionally well-tuned energy systems increase flux throughput and capacity by %s over standard examples of this hull.

hull_mods.name: Militarized Hegemony Auxiliary
hull_mods.desc: This ship is - or was - on the Hegemony auxiliary list. Uparmour kits applied at Hegemony Naval yards resulting in no loss of performance for a %s/%s/%s/%s increase in armor strength, depending on hull size. Core power systems have been upgraded to military standards resulting in a %s improvement in overall handling, %s increase in flux capacity, a %s increase in flux dissipation, and an increase of maximum burn level by %s.

hull_mods.name: Compromised Armor
hull_mods.desc:
This ship's armor has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Armor rating reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Compromised Hull
hull_mods.desc:
This ship's hull has taken major and irreparable damage at some point in the past, or suffered from major errors in the manufacturing process. Hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Degraded Engines
hull_mods.desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's engines are suffering from permanently degraded combat performance. 

Top speed and maneuverability in combat reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Degraded Drive Field
hull_mods.desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's drive field is suffering from permanently degraded performance. 

Maximum burn level decreased by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Faulty Power Grid
hull_mods.desc:
Whether due to battle damage, manufacturing defects, or cycles of poor maintenance, this ship's power grid will never be capable of achieving peak performance.

Flux capacity reduced by %s. Flux dissipation rate reduced by %s. Sensor profile increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Phase Coil Instability
hull_mods.desc:
The phase coils on this ship are impossible to calibrate properly due to subtle flaws. Reduces the phase-time bonus by %s, reduces the peak performance time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Structural Damage
hull_mods.desc:
This ship's hull has likely taken extreme damage in the past, possibly to the point of breaking apart. Armor rating reduced by %s, hull integrity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Glitched Sensor Array
hull_mods.desc:
The ship's sensor array is damaged past any repair short of a complete hull overhaul. Weapon range in combat reduced by %s. Sensor strength reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Malfunctioning Comms
hull_mods.desc:
The comm system has suffered serious damage, making punching through battlefield jamming even more of a challenge. Fighter engagement range reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Defective Manufactory
hull_mods.desc:
The manufactory that produces fighter chassis is unreliable, and most components have minor defects. Fighter speed reduced by %s, and damage taken increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Damaged Flight Deck
hull_mods.desc:
The flight decks on this ship have taken major damage and seriously interfere with normal operation. Time to launch replacement fighters is increased by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Unreliable Subsystems
hull_mods.desc:
A widespread loss of redundant components reduces peak operating time by %s, and increases the rate at which combat readiness degrades by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Compromised Storage
hull_mods.desc:
The storage capacity of this ship is significantly degraded. Crew, cargo, and fuel capacity reduced by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.

hull_mods.name: Increased Maintenance
hull_mods.desc:
Increases the monthly maintenance supply cost by %s. Increases minimum crew required by %s. Decreases maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases maintenance cost and crew requirements, decreases maximum combat readiness.

hull_mods.name: Erratic Fuel Injector
hull_mods.desc:
Increases fuel use by %s and decreases the zero-flux boost by %s su/second.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases fuel use and decreases the zero-flux boost.

hull_mods.name: Faulty Automated Systems
hull_mods.desc:
Increases minimum crew required by %s and decreases maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases minimum crew required, decreases maximum combat readiness.

hull_mods.name: Damaged Weapon Mounts
hull_mods.desc:
Reduces weapon turn rate by %s and increases recoil by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Reduces weapon turn rate and increases recoil.

hull_mods.name: Degraded Life Support
hull_mods.desc:
Decreases maximum crew capacity by %s, and maximum combat readiness by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Decreases maximum crew capacity and combat readiness.

hull_mods.name: Degraded Shields
hull_mods.desc:
Increases the amount of damage taken by shields by %s.

Supply cost to recover from deployment reduced by %s.
hull_mods.short: Increases damage taken by shields.

hull_mods.name: Destroyed Weapon Mounts
hull_mods.desc: Some of the original weapon mounts on this ship have been damaged beyond repair and can no longer be used.

hull_mods.name: Ill-Advised Modifications
hull_mods.desc: This hull's systems have been drastically modified from spec, likely without certified engineering oversight. Its systems appear to work correctly under routine conditions, but have a significant chance of critical malfunction when stressed.

descriptions.text1:
A category of ancient low-cost, readily available rapid fire weapons which have been used effectively versus missiles and fighters at short range throughout the history of space combat. Nearly useless against properly armored targets.

Due to ease of manufacture and modification, hundreds of variants exist. Any of these weapons which rapid-fire chemically propelled inert projectiles - easily churned out by even a crude autoforge - under a certain caliber are classified as light ship-mounted machine guns. The mechanisms which drive the actions of these weapons vary considerably. 

Popular with small civilian craft due to low cost. The dense core of projectiles are often jacketed with harder metal to assist feed operation and penetration. These weapon systems deliver a surprisingly large amount of kinetic energy at close-range despite their primitive design.

An upgraded, twin barrel version of the venerable light machine gun. Not especially effective against well-armored targets, but has excelled in an anti-missile and fighter role since the dawn of human space combat.

This is a dual mount of the same rapid fire, inert, low-caliber chemical projectile weapon known to every pilot and armorer in the Sector. An excellent point defense mount, which excels in both a missile interdiction and anti-fighter role. 

The large amount of kinetic energy delivered to shield systems of enemy craft at close-range typically causes emitter overload, a tactical option often overlooked by inexperienced captains.

An antiquated weapon that launches anti-armor rounds at a low rate of fire, muzzle velocity, and range. Low flux buildup is the lone saving grace.

The weapon blueprints for Light Mortars were not intended for spacecraft at all, but an ingenious modification to the breech loading mechanism permits installation and use outside an atmospheric environment. In combat, the Light Mortar performs poorly against swiftly moving or shielded targets due to its terrible mount rotation and rate of fire. Nonetheless, it is often used to train novice gunnery officers in the finer points of space ballistics tactics and nomenclature.

Commonly fitted on private yachts and solo interplanetary vehicles due to low mass and cost.

An antiquated weapon that fires larger anti-armor rounds at a somewhat higher rate of fire than its smaller cousin. Projectile speed is low and effective range is short. Low flux buildup is the lone saving grace.

The Heavy Mortar was originally designed for use in planetary surface combat. Ostensibly intended for cracking military fortifications, it saw far more use in urban bombardment. The robust internal mechanisms permit installation and use outside an atmospheric environment with only minor adjustments, notably replacement of the automatic rangefinder/targeting module. When employed against large, unshielded, and slow-moving targets, the heavy mortar can prove most effective.

A rapid fire ballistic point-defense weapon system especially devastating to missiles and fighters at near point-blank range. Accuracy degrades sharply during prolonged bursts of fire. 

This multi-barrel weapon platform is built around an advanced timing mechanism most commonly manufactured by Hegemony-authorized nanoforges. Rounds are typically tipped with depleted uranium and are non explosive. Multiple barrels enable an extremely high rate of fire, though at a high flux cost.

A small caliber autocannon with a good range for such a light chassis. Designed to counter enemy shields and especially effective against the weaker generators used in smaller hulls.

Features high velocity kinetic rounds which provide excellent fire support weapon for smaller craft. Poor mount turn rate due to a complex autoloader and liquid cooling make the Light Autocannon a poor choice for defense against fighters and missiles.

A double barreled version of the Light Autocannon. An excellent weapon for close-range support, and quite effective at bringing shields down, it suffers from a shorter effective range due to high recoil.

An ingenious mechanical design prevents ejection ports from being jammed while expelling twice as many spent shell casings as the standard Light Autocannon chassis. Like the single barrel version, this weapon system fires high velocity rounds designed to punch through enemy shields. Autoloader and liquid cooling systems are otherwise identical to the single barrel version.

A small caliber cannon designed for close-range fights, excellent against armor and with a superb fire rate.

Small caliber cannon designed to fire high-explosive rounds. Design of the coolant systems and autoloader emphasizes safety and prevention of cook-off potentially caused by high flux levels. Favored by destroyer captains that have something to prove.

Releases a cluster of free-floating bomblets that retain the momentum of the launching craft. The bomblets are equipped with a proximity fuse.

A Frag Bomb projector fires Mark VI fragmentation bomblets from three tubes. Unguided and without a propulsion system, the bomblets rely on a friend-or-foe targeting system. Their vast numbers allow them to cover a wide swath of space, effectively creating a Point Defense barrier in that location, albeit for a limited time. When the proximity fuse is triggered by an enemy craft, the bomblet will detonate, achieving similar effects to those of flak weapons.

Releases a cluster of free-floating, high-explosive bomblets. More effective versus unshielded and slow-moving targets.

A Cluster Bomb projector is equipped with three tubes designed to fire dozens of Mark II Explosively Formed Penetrator bomblets. The bomblets are unguided and have no propulsion system, relying on the initial momentum of the strike craft to engage the target. They are equipped with a friend-or-foe targeting scanner, and will only detonate when impacting an appropriate target. The shaped charge explosive is highly effective versus unshielded targets. The sheer number of bomblets that can be deployed by this weapon system is staggering, and as such it makes the Cluster Bomb a useful area denial weapon.

A tried and tested weapon system, the bomb bay holds multiple warheads that rely on the velocity of the launching craft to reach their target.

Each bomb bay is equipped with several non guided high-explosive Comp-X bombs that can be released one at a time. The bombs have no propulsion system and are dependent on the velocity of the launching craft to carry them to target (i.e., dive bombing).  Atmospheric shielding intrinsic to the design also gives the bombs a high time-to-live in a hostile point-defense environment.

Fires bursts of small flechettes at a high rate of fire. The volume of fire can quickly overwhelm shield projectors, but is generally ineffective against armor.

A Light Needler is a small-bore flechette gun, designed to fire caseless ammunition. Features an impressive feed system which can deliver hundreds of "needles" per second. There is no need for an ejector system, and the saved space is used to provide additional cooling units, vastly enhancing the rate of fire. 

Domain Naval doctrine holds that the weapon is to be used on enemy shields at long-range, but in a pinch, gunnery officers will train their Needlers on enemy fighter wings and long-range missile threats.

A high-tech improvement of the Autocannon, the railgun fires accurate, medium-range slugs. Like the AC, it excels at overwhelming enemy shield generators.

A miniaturized version of the Gauss Cannon, the railgun relies on a strong magnetic field to fire shells at high velocities. The accuracy and range are excellent, and the turret is able to rotate quickly while not firing. 

The railgun is preferred to the Autocannon by gunnery officers that have ample flux capacity at their disposal.

A rotary cannon generously engineered to provide for great ease of operation and reliability. Weapons officers across the professional navies of the Persean Sector, meanwhile, curse the Thumper for rewarding poor maintenance habits. 

Shreds enemy missiles and fighters with an overwhelming hail of small payload, medium velocity fragmentation rounds. Although flux-efficient, this weapon system has little effect against armor and shields.

A defensive weapon system that fires shrapnel-filled shells equipped with a proximity fuse for maximum effect against fighters and missiles.

The rising prominence of small, cheap fighter craft, especially in the strike role, led to a wider deployment of this weapons system in the heady days pre-Collapse. Fires ballistic rounds fitted with a proximity fuse. The resulting explosion sends a hail of flechettes in a wide volume with a respectable kill radius versus standard targets. Newer models feature a fire control system hardwired into a Mark VI Predictor.

A larger cousin of the ubiquitous rapid-fire machine gun category of weapons, the Heavy MG is effective against both small and medium-sized targets.

A workhorse of patrol craft across the Sector, this weapons system features reliable blowback firing mechanism said to date back to the days of Old Earth. Safety features include a positive cook-off safety for open bolt clearing and double ram prevention. The weapon is typically mounted on a relatively massive base to help absorb recoil during prolonged bursts of fire. Calibers vary within a moderate range and ammunition is easily fabricated by standard forges. 

The heavier projectiles do not shatter upon impact like lighter ammunition and present a credible threat to frigate-class vessels. Extremely accurate, though slower-firing than a vulcan cannon. Excels in a point-defense role.

An antiquated weapon design with high per-shot damage for its size. The kinetic shells are especially effective versus enemy shields.

Heavier patrol craft at the time of the Collapse were mostly fitted with the Arbalest Mk I weapons platform; this likely explains why the Arbalest is claimed to be among the most scavenged ship weapon systems in the Sector. The primitive cooling system and a lack of an autoejector hamper rate of fire and reliability. 

The only redeeming feature is the ubiquity of blueprints for the arbalest round, which is effective at bringing down enemy shields. The effectiveness of the shells is poorly understood, and is suspected to lie in the unintended electromagnetic properties of the shell jackets.

An upgraded, viciously effective dual mount of the Flak Cannon. Nicknamed "The Widowmaker" for its ability to tear apart incoming fighters.

Just like the standard flak cannon, this weapon devastates smaller fighter and missile targets, though it fires two proximity fuse fitted rounds. Shaped dispersal ensures dual detonation and a higher kill radius. Fighter craft are rarely intentionally launched against ships fitted with the Dual Flak for obvious reasons. Excellent rate of fire and turret turn rate.

The GA-X Industries Mk. II chaingun excels at close-range fighting, where accuracy is less important than overall damage and volume of fire.

A 'melee' captain's favorite tool, the Assault Chaingun delivers high-explosive shaped charge rounds on target at a fearsome rate. Features powered feed and ejector systems and an advanced nano-cooling unit built right into the barrel. 

The only drawback is a heavier turret profile which, coupled with the lack of the accompanying governor blueprint, is typically mounted on incompatible rotators giving rise to unexpectedly low turret rotation speeds.

An advanced weapon system designed to punch through armor plating at long-range. Has a low sustained rate of fire but high per-burst damage.

The heavy mauler is a brutal weapon designed to engage targets at medium to long-range. At its core, the weapon is an autocannon with a nano-cooling system and an external ejection port. However, unlike normal autocannons, the heavy mauler is distinguished by an antimatter barrel charger fed by trivial amounts of standard starship fuel.

When leaving the firing chamber, each shell ogive is charged with a field of antiprotons which hover 10-20 nanometers to the fore of the shell, stabilized by a baryon coating. On impact with a target, this antiproton "sheath" loses structural integrity and the resulting reaction does further damage. Given the fact that shells already deliver impressive destructive force to the target, the combined reaction makes the heavy mauler particularly effective versus armored targets.

A triple-barreled cannon that fires a burst of standardized shells at medium range. It is most effective versus enemy shields.

Medium caliber, triple-barreled autocannon, typically deployed with medium-bore ammunition. Electrically primed firing fuses ensure precise fire counts. A great fire support weapon, it is typically fitted on destroyer and cruiser class ships. A battery of heavy autocannons with a proper firing solution may pose a serious threat to capital ships. 

Additional mass necessity to accommodate the complex autoloader and cooling systems results in a very poor turn rate, however.

A specialized weapon designed to overload and disable enemy systems from afar. The high-velocity duranium slug is also effective against shields.

The hypervelocity driver uses a 2-stage process to accelerate a duranium slug with a magnetized iron-cobalt core to a very high velocity. A chemical charge accelerates the slug first, then the magnetic coils take over, accelerating the slug further and stabilizing its flight. The slug is highly charged by the time it reaches the target, generating a significant amount of electromagnetic interference on the ship it impacts.

A dual-mount of the Light Needler with a heavier base, this advanced weapon system is capable of quickly overwhelming shield projectors.

The Heavy Needler is an advanced weapon that fires small flechette rounds. An improvement upon the Light Needler, it features better feed and cooling systems, which enable an even greater rate of fire. Projectiles are identical to the light version: caseless ammunition tungsten-jacketed flechettes.

A long-range weapon designed to overload the target's shields. The heavy kinetic slug it fires is also effective against all but the heaviest armor.

Uses magnetic coils to accelerate a large ultra-dense composite slug to relativistic speeds. Usually rated at the hundreds of giga-amperes range, rarely exceeding one tera-ampere. And unlike most ballistic weapons, has a very high flux load when fired. Turrets mounted with this system have an extremely poor turn rate. 

Very effective weapon whose usefulness is limited by the low reactor power of ships that typically feature large ballistic weapon mounts.

A large ballistic gun system with good operational range, its high-explosive shaped-charge shells are designed to tear apart heavy armor. The raw damage output may also serve to overwhelm weaker shield emitters.

The Hephaestus Assault Gun is a truly devastating weapon platform named for an Old Earth deity associated with a distant predecessor to the nanoforge. A typical chassis features two L/89 barrels that trade off firing armor-destroying rounds at a high rate of fire. Electromagnetic ejector, powered feed system, and nanocoolants allow the weapon to fire for extended periods limited only by flux pool.

A tradition exists among Hegemony officers to comment upon the thump-thump of the Hephaestus recoil as "The heartbeat of the Hegemony Navy", to which the crew responds with a hearty "Ooh-rah!". Several drinking games with a similar theme albeit more crudely expressed are endured by portside bars much to the annoyance of proprietors due to the stomping and inevitable broken drinking vessels.

An imposing medium range autocannon which is used most effectively against shields, the Mark IX may also serve admirably to obliterate unarmored hull. A two-barrel designed and unique double-loader system allow the output of a large volume of heavy caliber projectile fire.

The Mark IX blueprints were first re-discovered by the Persean Sector in a drifting derelict captured in the gravity well of Penelope's Star. After a hasty examination of the files by an unqualified assessor - historical reports deemed the Mark IX obsolete due to poor performance against the heavily armored warships which were favored in that era - the blueprint was auctioned off and purchased by a small mercenary organization known as Tactistar, a military contractor which was then a subsidiary of the Ko Combine, and forgotten. After some cycles enough surplus capital was found to finally build a test a prototype for weapon trials. The Mark IX was generally unexceptional, considered overly large and mediocre against armored targets. Nonetheless, raw damage output was impressive and secondary trials showed devastating effect when employed against shielded targets.

Afterward, the Mark IX did not remain secret for long. Tactistar Combine profitably sold manufacturing rights throughout the Persean Sector and soon repurchased itself from its ever-ponderous parent corporation.

A sophisticated medium-range gun system that delivers superior damage alongside a significant EMP payload.

The Mjolnir is technically a magneto-gravitic projector rather than a cannon as traditionally understood. Each munition contains a small amount of exotic condensed matter and an isolated microsingularity which combine destructively upon impact, channeling energy through a temporary gravitic lens. The local effect results in devastation of ordinary matter and the release of a powerful electromagnetic pulse (EMP) which disables weapons and systems within the targeted ship.

Fires a withering hail of kinetic projectiles that easily overwhelm most shield projectors.

The Storm Needler is a large ballistic weapon system which fires caseless small-bore flechette ammunition. Having reached the practical limits of medium sized cooling systems, the designers of caseless ammunition blazed a path into larger weapons with the Storm Needler's advanced nano coolant recyclers, per-barrel magnetized rifling, and automated operation. An intelligent autoloader unpacks and loads just the right amount of ammunition from the magazines, allowing for prolonged operation provided the host ship has adequate flux capacity.

A huge cannon which fires slow-moving plasma-charged projectiles. Rounds are highly effective versus armor and obliterate any hull structure left underneath.

A feared weapon platform, rarely deployed due to the complexity involved in manufacturing a built-up barrel that can safely fire enormous high-explosive shaped charge rounds. When such a shell impacts a target, the Neumann effect causes the warhead to propel a jet of molten metal into the target's armor, vaporizing a small area, causing hull breaches, depressurization, and extensive internal damage from the spall.

A single unguided torpedo of devastating yield with a powerful on-board engine.

The quintessential strike weapon, a single Reaper torpedo is a large self-propelled, armored, unguided delivery system for an enriched AM-catalyzed nuclear warhead. The science behind the surprisingly compact detonator is poorly understood in the Sector though widely speculated to be based on physics classified as secret by Domain authority. What is known is that three or four of these slipping through PD arcs are enough to destroy even the largest capital ship.

A rack of advanced guided torpedoes. The payload is smaller than usual to make room for the advanced guidance package and maneuvering system's reaction mass.

The Atropos torpedo is a large guided torpedo with an extended range. Each rack mounts two torpedoes which can be fired separately, allowing strike captains maximum flexibility. The AM-catalyzed nuclear warhead typically used in torpedo warheads is missing here as baryonic interference from the detonator would foul the guidance systems. It is replaced by a smaller, yet still potent chemical charge.

A single advanced, guided torpedo. The payload is smaller than usual to make room for the advanced guidance package and maneuvering system's reaction mass.

The Atropos torpedo is a large guided torpedo with an extended range. The AM-catalyzed nuclear warhead typically used in torpedo warheads is missing here as baryonic interference from the detonator would foul the guidance systems. It is replaced by a smaller, yet still potent chemical charge.

This mount features only a single torpedo.

A short range guided missile launcher. The missiles are designed to intercept agile targets, and are primarily effective against small craft such as frigates and fighters.

Launches bursts of small missiles. A simple infrared system provides effective tracking while chemical microthrusters provide exceptional maneuverability. Evolutionary targeting algorithms honed over centuries of real-world application allow the missiles to lead the target - they rarely miss and are very hard to avoid.
A short range guided missile launcher. The missiles are designed to intercept and destroy enemy fighters.

Fires a spread of unguided rockets that cover a wide arc. Typically used to strip away enemy armor once shields are down.

Medium to long-range rockets launched from a small pod that fires five missiles per salvo in a narrow spread to improve the odds of hitting. Rockets are small and unguided, with the extra space being taken up by a larger warhead and improved propulsion systems, as well as thicker armor. 

Performs well against larger targets due to the higher chance of striking with multiple rockets. A rocket attack is often used as a screen before a torpedo strike to reduce the effectiveness of Point Defense systems. Takes several seconds to reload after a salvo.
Fires a salvo of unguided rockets. Typically used to strip away enemy armor once shields are down.

Fires a stream of unguided rockets. Useful for dealing with enemy armor, or - due to having no flux cost - applying sustained pressure.

Features the same medium to long-range rockets found on smaller launchers. Rockets are unguided, with the extra space being taken up by a larger warhead and improved propulsion systems, as well as thicker armor. 

Performs well against larger targets due to the higher chance of striking with multiple rockets. A rocket attack is often used as a screen before a torpedo strike to reduce the effectiveness of Point Defense systems.

Homes in on the target's engines and disables them with a powerful EMP burst. A combat-rated autoloader system ensures usefulness in protracted engagements.

The Salamander missile is a specialized weapon with two design considerations. The first is an extremely advanced tracking/targeting mechanism which enables it to home in on enemy engines, whilst avoiding all other potential impact points and Point Defense threats. 

The second is a special warhead design which, instead of attempting to destroy the target with kinetic or explosive force, generates targeted electromagnetic fields of high magnitude. When such a field is created in the proximity of unshielded engines and hull components, it will quickly knock out all their electronics, rendering them useless until repaired.

Homes in on the target's engines and disables them with a powerful EMP burst. A combat-rated autoloader system ensures usefulness in protracted engagements.

An externally mounted pod replaces the more common missile racks and allows two missiles to be fired almost simultaneously. An autoloader extracts, arms and primes the next salvo of two missiles after a short wait.

The Salamander missile is a specialized weapon with two design considerations. The first is an extremely advanced tracking/targeting mechanism which enables it to home in on enemy engines, whilst avoiding all other potential impact points and Point Defense threats. 

The second is a special warhead design which, instead of attempting to destroy the target with kinetic or explosive force, generates targeted electromagnetic fields of high magnitude. When such a field is created in the proximity of unshielded engines and hull components, it will quickly knock out all their electronics, rendering them useless until repaired.

Medium range, high payload guided missile rack. Devastating against ships with downed shields.

Three-racked medium range missiles. An excellent propulsion system delivers a large warhead to the target at sublight speeds. Sacrificing maneuverability for speed and warhead size, the medium range missile is one of the highest yield non strike weapons employed in the Sector. One hit is almost fatal to frigate-sized ships.

This weapon system features a firing rack that houses multiple missiles.

Medium range, high payload guided missile pod. Devastating against ships with downed shields.

An externally mounted pod replaces the more common missile racks and allows multiple missiles to be fired almost simultaneously. An autoloader extracts, arms and primes the next salvo of missiles after a short wait.

These medium range missiles are identical to the ones fired from single or triple racks, and are a great way to finish off a ship with downed shields. An excellent propulsion system delivers a large warhead to the target at sublight speeds. Sacrificing maneuverability for speed and warhead size, the medium range missile is one of the highest yield non strike weapons employed in the sector. One hit is almost fatal to frigate-sized ships.

Medium range, high payload guided missile. Devastating against ships with downed shields.

An excellent propulsion system delivers a large warhead to the target at sublight speeds. Sacrificing maneuverability for speed and warhead size, the medium range missile is one of the highest yield non strike weapons employed in the sector. One hit is almost fatal to frigate-sized ships.

This mount can only launch one missile at a time, and carries a single replacement in a combat-rated magazine recessed into the hull.

Fires a 2nd-stage spread of high-velocity kinetic penetrators when in range. Heavy damage to shields, and massive EMP damage when impacting on enemy hull or armor. Difficult to stop with PD.

Sabot-class class missiles are short-range, two-stage KE weapons. A guided missile first stage projects a secondary assembly to within striking distance of a shielded target. The on-board targeting computer then ignites the propellant for a KE penetrator. This 'sabot', as it is commonly called, is typically a narrow, laterally stabilized projectile manufactured from an ultra dense material such as depleted uranium.

Excellent at bringing down enemy shields and causing an overload. Standard ship armor is spaced and thus the sabot deals more manageable damage if shields are lowered in time to receive the impact on armor.

This weapon system features a firing rack that houses multiple missiles.

Fires a 2nd-stage spread of high-velocity kinetic penetrators when in range. Heavy damage to shields, and massive EMP damage when impacting on enemy hull or armor. Difficult to stop with PD.

The pod replaces the more common missile racks and allows multiple missiles to be fired almost simultaneously. An autoloader extracts, arms and primes the next salvo of missiles after a short delay.

The on-board targeting computer then ignites the propellant for a KE penetrator. This 'sabot', as it is commonly called, is typically a narrow, laterally stabilized projectile manufactured from an ultra dense material such as depleted uranium.
